instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN: What is SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN? SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on power to the wifi circuit when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> can't activate wifi
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got this macbook with water damage near smc are. IT was turning on but with no wifi and sound. Replaced SMC ( ppus was not stable and there was no light on magsafe , I/O board and flex. Sound is ok now but wifi not working. 


airport is detected but cant activate it. already tested if it can be macos issue but with other OS do same thing.


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> can't activate wifi
threads.message:
Solved. 

<SIGNAL>SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> signal was not stable. Sometimes it activated sometimes not. Reflow SMC and now is ok.
